vars.introductiontoresumateline1: Resumate is a handy tool to write your personal site. You don't need to know anything about writing codes - just write definitions to tell what you are going to show to your visitors, using some predefined templates. Of course, you can expand functionalities of Resumate by writing your own templates as well.

vars.introductiontoresumateline3: There are four different types of renderable configuration files for Resumate: page, block, template and html, in an decomposing order, and they have similar grammars (especially for the first three kinds). For each JSON configuration file, name, type are required, with optional content and vars. The JSON above defined a page, which will be rendered as a page to be read by visitors. It contains a string with HTML markup, a link to http://example.com/ showing “This is a link”, two highlighted blocks for JSON (just like the one you see above), and quoted a block called someblock. You can write HTML in an ordinary string, and it will be rendered as well since Resumate will transparently pass HTML strings without any treatment.

vars.resumateintro:
Resumate is a tool allowing you to render HTML pages using JSON-based templates, which is convienient for occationally updated page with repeating elements (e.g.: a Ph.D. personal homepage with a list of publications, formatted with title, authors, description and link). Using Resumate, it is able to quote the template ten times and give title, authors, description and link easily, instead of copying and pasting HTML for ten times and insert those information in their repective places. Resumate also comes with multi-language and site theme support, so you don't need to worry about globalizing or beautifying your page.

You can also find the JSON source code of this page you are currently reading - on GitHub.

content: edu_template_title is the title of this template, which quoted Macro $educationexp$: Use $ symbol at the start/end of the Macro name to request the value of the Macro. This Macro is defined in the language file, and Resumate will show different value for this Macro in different languages. In this language, its value is:“

edu_template_phd is a place to show your Doctorate experience. Here, we provided a list containing $educationphdstart$, a template (to generate HTML links), and the final $educationphdend$. The list will be resolved by Resumate into an HTML string, then passed into edu_template_phd. You can also substitute this list using a single line with HTML, since Resumate will pass HTML strings transparently.
edu_template_ms is a place to show your Masters experience. Similar to edu_template_title, the value of $educationms$ will be passed to edu_template_ms。
edu_template_bachelor is a place to show your Bachelors experience. Similar to edu_template_title, the value of $educationbachelor$ will be passed to edu_template_bachelor。

edu_template_comment is a place to elaborate a little bit more for your education experience. Similar to edu_template_title, the value of $educationdescription$ will be passed to edu_template_comment。

samplecodeexplainmain: After Resumate resolves the template into HTML, it will be passed into its upper level (the Page or Block that requested it), and ultimately becomes a pure HTML page.
